question: When the water is cold Ellen swims a mile in 19 minutes. When the water is warm Ellen swims a mile in 1 minutes more than thrice as long. How much longer does Ellen take to swim 7 miles on a hot day than a cold day?
answer:
Cold water mile = <<19=19>>19 minutes
Warm water mile = 1+3*19=58 minutes
7 miles in cold water: 7(19)=<<7*19=133>>133 minutes
7 miles in warm water: 7(58)=<<7*58=406>>406 minutes
Ellen takes 406-133=<<406-133=273>>273 minutes longer
#### 273
